titles.title: Discount Pricing Consumer Protection Act of 2011
Discount Pricing Consumer Protection Act of 2011

To restore the rule that agreements between manufacturers and retailers, distributors, or wholesalers to set the price below which the manufacturer's product or service may not be sold violates the Sherman Act.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Intellectual Property, Competition and the Internet.

bill.summary: Discount Pricing Consumer Protection Act of 2011 - Provides that any agreement setting a price below which a product or service may not be sold by a retailer, wholesaler, or distributor violates the Sherman Act.
